metadata.title: CVE-2016-1632 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Extensions subsystem in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.75 does notproperly maintain own properties, which allows remote attackers to bypassintended access restrictions via crafted JavaScript code that triggers anincorrect cast, related to extensions/renderer/v8_helpers.h andgin/converter.h.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112').
